result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheldon L. Cloud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: Must seek and maintain full-time employment or a combination of employment and education which is satisfactory to your probation agent.  Defendant  must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your probation agent.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located. 

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means, with any of the following individuals: Victim 1 or Victim 2.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. 

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen and report for booking. Contact the Jackson County Sheriff's Department at 715-284-5357 to arrange for an appointment.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Must pay all costs of supervision and court ordered financial obligations during the term of probation.
Cash bond on file applied to costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

1:39 PM Defendant Sheldon L. Cloud in court.  Attorney Stephanie K. Osborne in court for Sheldon L. Cloud.  Attorney Emily Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin. State is in compliance with victim rights. No restitution.  Defendant pleads no contest to count 1 on 21CF114 and 22CM3 count 1 pleads no contest.  Remainder counts in 22CM3 DRI.

Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of  Escape-Criminal Arrest contrary to 946.42(3)(a), Habitual Criminality contrary to 939.62(1)(b) in 21CF114.  Found guilty of Battery contrary to 940.19(1), Domestic Abuse Incident contrary to 968.075(1)(a) in 22CM3. Counts 2,3 & 4 DRI in 22CM3. Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution.


State recommends sentence withheld 2 years probation with the following conditions; Obtain/maintain employment, no alcohol, comply with AODA, risk and needs, no contact with Victim 1, 2 (22CM3).  On the 21CF114 90 days conditional jail. 176 days credit if revoked.
Atty Osborne makes record.  asks the court to adopt the joint recommendation.

Court adopts joint recommendation. Orders sentence withheld 2 years probation. Must obtain/maintain employment, no alcohol provisions, risk and needs and comply, AODA assessment and any additional treatment recommended by agent.  No contact with Victim 1 & 2 in the 22CM3 case.  21CF114 case orders 90 day jail sanction- conditional of probation if revoked 176 days credit.  Costs pay during probation- bond on file applied to costs- $250 applied to the $543. Report to probation no later than 3:30pm. Report to jail 8/25 no later than 9AM.

Plea/sentencing hearing on August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ALL PARTIES TO THE ACTION SHALL APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THIS HEARING.  THIS HEARING IS NOT BEING HELD VIA ZOOM.
STC canceled and being scheduled for PLEAS per request of Attorney Stephanie Osborne; ok'd with T.D. in DA's office. CLO

Status conference on June 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
